Award.AwardTitle: MRI: Acquisition of A Scanning Electron Microscope for Multidisciplinary Research on Materials and Devices

Division.LongName: Div Of Electrical, Commun & Cyber Sys

Award.AbstractNarration:
The objective of this MRI acquisition of a scanning electron microscope (SEM) is to enhance existing research programs, facilitate and promote new multidisciplinary research, enrich the educational curriculum, increase outreach activities involving K-12 students, and expand existing and future industrial collaborations at Oakland University.
Intellectual Merit
The requested scanning electron microscope (SEM) with energy dispersive spectroscopy (EDS) has imaging, structural, and chemical analysis capabilities for both conductive and non-conductive samples. The proposed SEM/EDS acquisition will result in a fundamental understanding of engineering, physics, and chemical aspects of MEMS devices, polymeric and metal nanocomposites, bio-inspired electronics and surface and interface chemical systems.
Broader Impacts
This acquisition has three broader impacts: (i) Scientifically and economically, the SEM/EDS will enable a higher level of research on materials, devices, and related technologies, which coincides with vigorous attempts being made to diversify the local economy and add new growth to the frontiers of discovery in Metro Detroit area. (ii) The SEM/EDS will contribute to our continued effort in graduate and undergraduate research training for which the research team has an excellent record. (iii) This acquisition will enhance our outreach programs where we have established close collaboration with local high schools to facilitate participation of high school students in research.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This MRI grant has funded the acquisition of a JSM-6510 scanning electron microscope (SEM) from JEOL USA. The SEM is capable of morphological imaging of a wide variety of solid specimens. It is also equipped with an energy-dispersive X-ray spectrometer (EDS) for the compositional analyses of solid materials.

Since its installation and acceptance in early 2011, as intended, this instrument has been playing a significant role in the promotion of scientific and engineering research, educational outreach programs and community services at Oakland University and beyond. 1). Seven research groups in four departments from two colleges have used this equipment as a fundamental tool in their research. This SEM has been greatly facilitating research in nano/micro materials and devices, tribology, biological sensors, new energy materials, etc. A total of 14 publications, including journal/conference papers and dissertations/theses, have been generated based on the results obtained from this SEM. Through this project, the collaborations among the principal investigators in this project have directly led to two additional NSF awards in the past two years. The project has prepared human resources in science and engineering by cultivating graduate and undergraduate students, post-doc associates and other young researchers in the participating research groups.  2). The acquired MRI SEM has benefitted our educational programs across the campus. In addition to helping the enrichment of the current curricula and development of future new curricula, the project has benefited NSF supported research experience for undergraduates (REU) programs in related departments as well. It has greatly inspired graduate and undergraduate students’ interests in research. 3). The acquired SEM has been proven to be a powerful tool in our educational outreach programs. The equipment has seen a total of over 800 K-12 students, parents and teachers in our open house activities as part of our outreach program. In these events, the SEM was always the most welcomed instrument to these diverse groups of people. The impact to our next generation has been huge and evident. The School of Engineering and Computer Science (SECS), where the project has been executed, has enjoyed dramatic increase of freshmen enrollment in the last two consecutive years. The equipment has a positive contribution to the increase. 4). As proposed in the application of the fund, the acquisition of the SEM has indeed contributed to the effort of South Eastern Michigan, particularly Oakland County, in diversifying its economy since the recent recession. The SEM has been used by two industrial companies and one high-tech startup in their product development and technology transfer. In achieving these, we have made the equipment self-sustainable.
